name: PoGOEvents
desc:
PoGOEvents is a [Scriptable](https://scriptable.app/) widget that displays current and upcoming [Pokemon GO](https://pokemongolive.com/) events.

All event data is gathered from [ScrapedDuck](https://github.com/bigfoott/ScrapedDuck), which scrapes [LeekDuck.com](https://leekduck.com) periodically.

name: ScrapedDuck
desc: ScrapedDuck is a project that routinely scrapes [LeekDuck.com](https://leekduck.com) and pushes the found data to a branch on the repository, to be used by other external applications.

name: MMM-PokemonGOEvents
desc:
MMM-PokemonGOEvents is a module for [MagicMirrorÂ²](https://magicmirror.builders/) that displays [Pokemon GO](https://pokemongolive.com/) events.

All event data is gathered from [ScrapedDuck](https://github.com/bigfoott/ScrapedDuck), which scrapes [LeekDuck.com](https://leekduck.com) periodically.

name: VRSpeed.run
desc:
VRSpeed.run is a central hub to view the leaderboards for the largest virtual reality games in speedrunning.

There are a few other projects such as a Twitter and Discord bot along side the website. Check them out at the GitHub organization below.

name: VR Laser Game
desc:
My VR Laser Game project is something I've been working on on-and-off since late 2018. It's a virtual reality puzzle game that makes use of the six degrees of freedom provided by VR to create a unique experience.

I've tried a few times to make the game, with my most successful attempt being my final project to get my Associate's in Computer Science (before moving on to a 4-year college to get my Bachelor's).

name: URBot
desc:
URBot is a verified [Discord](https://discord.com/) bot made for the roleplaying web show [URealms](https://urealms.com/).

I stopped maintaining this bot in October 2019, however for now the bot is still active and can be added to new servers.

name: BigftioBot
desc: BigftioBot was a [Twitch](https://twitch.tv/) chat bot. Features included custom commands, quotes, moderation tools, and more.

name: FCDisplay
desc:
FCDisplay was a mod for [Beat Saber](https://beatsaber.com/) that added a visual element to the game when the user hasn't missed a note.

I stopped maintaining the mod when an official version of this feature was added to the game.

name: ImmersiveMode
desc:
ImmersiveMode was a mod for [Beat Saber](https://beatsaber.com/) that disabled all UI while in a song, either just in-headset, just in the mirror, or both.

I stopped maintaining the mod when an official version of this feature (other than choosing between in-headset, in-mirror, etc.) was added to the game.

name: StreamInfo
desc:
StreamInfo was a mod for [Beat Saber](https://beatsaber.com/) that allowed players to display game info as an overlay on their streams or videos.

I stopped maintaining the mod due to my lack of knowledge at the time, on top of the release of a better alternative mod ([HTTP Status](https://github.com/opl-/beatsaber-http-status)).

name: Archive
desc: My portfolio archive includes old projects that don't necessarily reflect my current abilities, but are still notable enough (or meaningful enough to me) that I still want to feature them in my portfolio.
